3 def clampValue(val, valMax):
4  """ Makes sure that a value is within [-valMax, valMax] """
5  if valMax == None: return val
6  if val > valMax: return valMax
7  elif val < -1*valMax: return -1*valMax
8  else: return val
9 
10 class PIDController:
11  """!@brief Discrete PID controller approximated using the Tustin (trapezoid) approximation """
12  def __init__(self, kp=0, ki=0, kd=0, ts=0, feedforward=0, bufferLength=3) -> None:
13  #self.bufferLength = bufferLength
14  self.k1 = 0
15  self.k2 = 0
16  self.k3 = 0
17  self.e = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
18  self.y = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
19  self.feedforward = feedforward
20  if ts != 0: self.setConstants(kp, ki, kd, ts)
21  #
22  def setConstants(self, kp, ki, kd, ts):
23  """ Updates controller constants """
24  self.k1 = kp+((ki*ts)/2)+((2*kd)/ts)
25  self.k2 = ki*ts-((4*kd)/ts)
26  self.k3 = (-1*kp)+((ki*ts)/2)+((2*kd)/ts)
27  #
28  def update(self, e):
29  """
30  Performs one discrete controller update
31 
32  Receives: Input signal [float]
33  Returns: Output signal [float]
34  """
35  # Update buffered input and output signals
36  self.e = [e]+self.e[:len(self.e)-1]
37  self.y = [0]+self.y[:len(self.y)-1]
38  # Shorten variable names for better readability
39  e = self.e
40  y = self.y
41  # Calculate output signal and return output
42  y[0] = e[0]*self.k1 + e[1]*self.k2 + e[2]*self.k3 + y[2]
43  return y[0] + e[0]*self.feedforward
44 
45 class PT1Block:
46  """!@brief Discrete PT1 block approximated using the Tustin (trapezoid) approximation """
47  def __init__(self, kp=1, T1=0, ts=0, bufferLength=2) -> None:
48  self.k1 = 0
49  self.k2 = 0
50  self.e = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
51  self.y = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
52  if ts != 0: self.setConstants(kp, T1, ts)
53  #
54  def setConstants(self, kp, T1, ts):
55  """ Updates controller constants """
56  t = 2*(T1/ts)
57  self.k1 = kp/(1+t)
58  self.k2 = (1-t)/(1+t)
59  #
60  def update(self, e):
61  """
62  Performs one discrete controller update
63 
64  Receives: Input signal [float]
65  Returns: Output signal [float]
66  """
67  # Update buffered input and output signals
68  self.e = [e]+self.e[:len(self.e)-1]
69  self.y = [0]+self.y[:len(self.y)-1]
70  # Shorten variable names for better readability
71  e = self.e
72  y = self.y
73  # Calculate output signal and return output
74  y[0] = (e[0] + e[1])*self.k1 - y[1]*self.k2
75  return y[0]
76 
77 class DBlock:
78  """!@brief Discrete D Block approximated using the Tustin approximation """
79  def __init__(self, kd=0, ts=0, bufferLength=2) -> None:
80  self.k = 0
81  self.e = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
82  self.y = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
83  if ts != 0: self.setConstants(kd, ts)
84  #
85  def setConstants(self, kd, ts):
86  """ Updates controller constants """
87  self.k = (2*kd)/ts
88  #
89  def update(self, e):
90  """
91  Performs one discrete controller update
92 
93  Receives: Input signal [float]
94  Returns: Output signal [float]
95  """
96  if self.k == 0: return 0
97  # Update buffered input and output signals
98  self.e = [e]+self.e[:len(self.e)-1]
99  self.y = [0]+self.y[:len(self.y)-1]
100  # Shorten variable names for better readability
101  e = self.e
102  y = self.y
103  # Calculate output signal and return output
104  y[0] = e[0]*self.k - e[1]*self.k - y[1]
105  return y[0]
106 
107 class PT2Block:
108  """!@brief Discrete PT2 Block approximated using the Tustin approximation """
109  def __init__(self, T=0, D=0, kp=1, ts=0, bufferLength=3) -> None:
110  self.k1 = 0
111  self.k2 = 0
112  self.k3 = 0
113  self.k4 = 0
114  self.k5 = 0
115  self.k6 = 0
116  self.e = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
117  self.y = [0 for i in range(bufferLength)]
118  if ts != 0: self.setConstants(T, D, kp, ts)
119  #
120  def setConstants(self, T, D, kp, ts):
121  """ Updates controller constants """
122  self.k1 = 4*T**2 + 4*D*T*ts + ts**2
123  self.k2 = 2*ts**2 - 8*T**2
124  self.k3 = 4*T**2 - 4*D*T*ts + ts**2
125  self.k4 = kp*ts**2
126  self.k5 = 2*kp*ts**2
127  self.k6 = kp*ts**2
128  #
129  def update(self, e):
130  """
131  Performs one discrete controller update
132 
133  Receives: Input signal [float]
134  Returns: Output signal [float]
135  """
136  # Update buffered input and output signals
137  self.e = [e]+self.e[:len(self.e)-1]
138  self.y = [0]+self.y[:len(self.y)-1]
139  # Shorten variable names for better readability
140  e = self.e
141  y = self.y
142  # Calculate output signal and return output
143  y[0] = ( e[0]*self.k4 + e[1]*self.k5 + e[2]*self.k6 - y[1]*self.k2 - y[2]*self.k3 )/self.k1
144  return y[0]
145 
146 class smartPID:
147  """!@brief Implementation to mimick HEBI PID controller behaviour. Variable names are consistent with HEBI Gains format """
148  def __init__(self, kp=0, ki=0, kd=0, targetLP=0, outputLP=0, ts=0, feedforward=0, d_on_error=True, targetMax=None, outputMax=None) -> None:
149  self.d_on_error = d_on_error
150  if d_on_error:
151  self.PID = PIDController(kp=kp, ki=ki, kd=kd, ts=ts)
152  self.D = DBlock(kd=0, ts=ts)
153  else:
154  self.PID = PIDController(kp=kp, ki=ki, kd=0, ts=ts)
155  self.D = DBlock(kd=kd, ts=ts)
156  #
157  self.targetLP = targetLP
158  self.outputLP = outputLP
159  self.inputFilter = PT1Block(kp=1, T1=targetLP, ts=ts)
160  self.outputFilter = PT1Block(kp=1, T1=outputLP, ts=ts)
161  #
162  self.targetMax = targetMax
163  self.outputMax = outputMax
164  self.feedforward = feedforward
165  #
166  def setConstants(self, kp, ki, kd, ts):
167  """ Updates controller constants """
168  if self.d_on_error:
169  self.PID.setConstants(kp, ki, kd, ts)
170  else:
171  self.PID.setConstants(kp, ki, 0, ts)
172  self.D.setConstants(kd, ts)
173  #
174  self.inputFilter = PT1Block(kp=1, T1=self.targetLP, ts=ts)
175  self.outputFilter = PT1Block(kp=1, T1=self.outputLP, ts=ts)
176  #
177  def update(self, target, feedback):
178  """
179  Performs one discrete controller update
180 
181  Receives: Input signal [float]
182  Returns: Output signal [float]
183  """
184  # Clamp and low pass input
185  filteredInput = self.inputFilter.update(
186  clampValue(target, self.targetMax)
187  )
188  # Update internal control blocks
189  output = self.D.update(filteredInput) + self.PID.update(filteredInput - feedback)
190  # Clamp and low pass output
191  output = self.outputFilter.update(
192  clampValue(output + self.feedforward*filteredInput, self.outputMax)
193  )
194  return output
195 
196 class strategy4Controller:
197  """!@brief Models HEBI control strategy 4 using 3 PID controllers discretised using the Tustin approximation """
198  def __init__(self, ts=0, targetConstraints=[None, 3.43, 20], outputConstraints=[10, 1, 1], feedfowards=[0, 1, 1], d_on_errors=[True, True, False], constants=None) -> None:
199  """ Class constructor """
200  self.ts = ts
201  #
202  self.PositionPID = smartPID(
203  targetMax=targetConstraints[0],
204  outputMax=outputConstraints[0],
205  feedforward=feedfowards[0],
206  d_on_error=d_on_errors[0]
207  )
208  #
209  self.VelocityPID = smartPID(
210  targetMax=targetConstraints[1],
211  outputMax=outputConstraints[1],
212  feedforward=feedfowards[1],
213  d_on_error=d_on_errors[1],
214  outputLP=0.01
215  )
216  #
217  self.EffortPID = smartPID(
218  targetMax=targetConstraints[2],
219  outputMax=outputConstraints[2],
220  feedforward=feedfowards[2],
221  d_on_error=d_on_errors[2],
222  outputLP=0.001
223  )
224  #
225  self.PWMFilter = PT2Block(kp=1, T=0.0, D=10, ts=self.ts)
226  if constants != None: self.updateConstants(constants)
227  #
228  def updateConstants(self, constants):
229  """ Updates controller constants """
230  self.PositionPID.setConstants(constants[0], constants[1], constants[2], self.ts)
231  self.VelocityPID.setConstants(constants[3], constants[4], constants[5], self.ts)
232  self.EffortPID.setConstants( constants[6], constants[7], constants[8], self.ts)
233  #
234  def update(self, vecIn, feedback):
235  """
236  Takes feedback and control signal and processes output signal
237 
238  Format vecIn & feedback: [pos, vel, effort]
239  """
240  effort = self.PositionPID.update(vecIn[0], feedback[0])
241  PWM1 = self.EffortPID.update(vecIn[2] + effort, feedback[2])
242  PWM2 = self.VelocityPID.update(vecIn[2], feedback[2])
243  return self.PWMFilter.update(PWM1 + PWM2)
244 
245 def PWM2Torque(PWM, maxMotorTorque=7.5):
246  """ Converts PWM output signals of the strategy 4 controller to direct torque outputs (Nm) for Pybullet """
247  # PWM range -> [-1, 1], Since we have X5-4 motors, the max torque is 7.5 Nm
248  # We just assume the conversion to be linear, might be fancier if I have time to measure a more exact conversion
249  # Source: https://docs.hebi.us/core_concepts.html#control-strategies
250  return PWM*maxMotorTorque
251 
252 def deserialiseJointstate(js):
253  """ Converts Jointstate message into the format used for the strategy 4 controller """
254  return [ [pos, vel, eff] for pos, vel, eff in zip(js.position, js.velocity, js.effort) ]
